text: I have a script which seems to cause Julia to lock up after an hour or two. Any clues as to how I might debug this? It seems to happen after running various calculations & plotting, and at some point later (while I’m not looking, nor waiting for something to run) the REPL freezes, with 100% cpu usage, until I kill it.

elements.text: I have a script which seems to cause Julia to lock up after an hour or two. Any clues as to how I might debug this? It seems to happen after running various calculations & plotting, and at some point later (while I’m not looking, nor waiting for something to run) the REPL freezes, with 100% cpu usage, until I kill it.

text: 4-5 times so far. Julia 1.5 and nightly. Script involves Plots, Zygote, saving & loading from disk. Mac with 10.14.

text: is it supposed to be running continously?

elements.text: is it supposed to be running continously?

text: No, it’s a few pages of random calculations, note-book-style, which I paste into the repl. Some quick, some half-hour calculations, some of which I’ve now saved to disk (as in `open`… `write(io, mat)` just floats nothing fancy) so as not to wait. Lots of global variables, very much rough exploratory stuff.
